content:
Diagnosis
	1. Collecting duct carcinoma of right kidney with bone metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right cytoreductive nephrectomy

	Systemic therapy
	1. Gemcitabine/Cisplatin commenced Feb 2024
	2. Changed to Cabozantinib 60mg OD March 2024 due to disease progression

	Radiotherapy
	20Gy in 5# to T8 metastasis completed 15 Apr 2024

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new symptomatic bone lesions

	Current issues
	1. Deteriorating mobility
	2. Bone pain
	3. Hypercalcemia

	Summary of consultation

Unfortunately [redacted name] has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past 2 weeks. His mobility has declined markedly, now requiring wheelchair for all transfers. He describes severe pain affecting thoracic spine and left hip despite recent radiotherapy to T8. Recent MRI spine shows new metastatic deposits at T4 and L2 with epidural extension at T4 level.

Blood tests show worsening hypercalcemia (corrected calcium 3.1) and deteriorating renal function (eGFR 32). Performance status has declined to ECOG 3. CT scan performed yesterday demonstrates progressive disease with increasing size of bone metastases and new pulmonary nodules.

On examination, there is marked tenderness over thoracic spine with reduced power in lower limbs (4/5 bilaterally). No sensory level identified.

	Further investigations
	1. Urgent MRI whole spine
	2. Bone profile and renal function in 48 hours

	Management plan
	1. Immediate admission for IV fluids and bisphosphonate
	2. Urgent neurosurgical review regarding T4 lesion
	3. Increase analgesia - commenced on Oxycodone MR 40mg BD
	4. Discontinue Cabozantinib due to disease progression
	5. Consider 3rd line therapy options once stabilized

	Follow up
	Urgent admission arranged to oncology ward

	Required GP actions
	None - patient being admitted
